title: Release of v0.2.1 of other crates
Upgrade all dependencies
body:
Upgraded all dependencies and removed the clap dependency from `unftp-sbe-fs`.

Also added to the release notes.

title: Fix windows paths
body:
This fixes the display issues mentioned in https://github.com/bolcom/libunftp/pull/413#issuecomment-1158995676, for all the FTP clients I've tested.

I also added a missing import that was making the test suite not compile. At the moment everything I've tested works correctly on Windows and all the tests pass.

title: Allow lowercase UTF8 OPTS
body:
The FTP client included in Windows Explorer sends this command in lowercase. Without this patch the server would respond with an invalid command error and the client would refuse to continue.

Wireshark trace for reference:
![winftp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/725423/174318960-bc351927-0b8b-498c-a983-ac4ba0a055f5.png)

title: Fix issue where the control loop did not exit
body:
Our logic in the control loop didn't actually detect a disconnect on the
TCP stream which meant the control loop won't exit if the client
abruptly disconnects. It would only disconnect after the idle timeout.
This is obviously not good so herewith the fix.

title: Add event label to ftp_reply_total metric
body:
The `ftp_reply_total` metric had no way to correlate it back to the type
of event for which a reply is given. I've changed this now so that the
metrics would look something like this:

```
clients.
ftp_reply_total{event="auth",event_type="command",range="2xx"} 1
ftp_reply_total{event="authsuccess",event_type="ctrl-chan-msg",range="2xx"}
1
ftp_reply_total{event="directorysuccessfullylisted",event_type="ctrl-chan-msg",range="2xx"}
1
ftp_reply_total{event="feat",event_type="command",range="2xx"} 1
ftp_reply_total{event="list",event_type="command",range="1xx"} 1
ftp_reply_total{event="opts",event_type="command",range="2xx"} 1
ftp_reply_total{event="pasv",event_type="command",range="2xx"} 1
ftp_reply_total{event="pbsz",event_type="command",range="2xx"} 1
ftp_reply_total{event="prot",event_type="command",range="2xx"} 1
ftp_reply_total{event="user",event_type="command",range="3xx"} 1
```

Notice the new `event` and `event_type` labels.

The same was done for the `ftp_error_total` metric.

title: Log username as separate field in control loop
Log path as a separate structured logging field
Support Range header in GCS API during RETR
body:
Currently the _Restart of Interrupted Transfer (REST)_ implementation is
very naive. It basically re-reads the GCS object while dumping the bytes
not needed by the client into the void.

GCS however have a feature where you can specify an HTTP header named
Range that allow you to stream only needed bytes of the object,
effectivly supporting what we need for REST. See
https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/json_api/v1/parameters#range

This commit adds support to the GCS back-end for the Range header.

title: Add API to allow listening for file events
Upgrades
body:
Upgrades

- Easy dependencies
- Rustls
- Rust edition to 2021

title: Shutdown API improvements
body:
I'm changing the shutdown API to hopefully be more ergonomic.

Now `Server.shutdown_indicator` takes a normal future, but it must return a struct containing shutdown options: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2511554/141526275-f98e4b8d-4180-4085-aefd-0e0c8b9460ac.png)

title: Add shutdown grace period
body:
Improvement for #386

When doing a graceful shutdown you don't want things to take to long, so a grace period can be specified.

Logs for shutdown within grace period:

```
 Nov 12 16:07:19.160 INFO Shutting down FTP server
 Nov 12 16:07:19.160 INFO HTTP shutdown OK
lib: libunftp
 Nov 12 16:07:19.160 DEBG Shutting down within 10s
 Nov 12 16:07:19.161 DEBG Graceful shutdown complete
module: main
```

and the not so happy case:

```
 Nov 12 16:27:35.985 INFO HTTP shutdown OK
lib: libunftp
 Nov 12 16:27:35.985 DEBG Shutting down within 10s
 trace-id: 0x45bb0af218d17c28
  source: 127.0.0.1:57427
   Nov 12 16:27:35.985 INFO Shutting down control loop
 Nov 12 16:27:45.987 WARN Could not finish shutdown normally within grace period
module: main
 Nov 12 16:27:45.988 ERRO FTP server error: ServerError { msg: "shutdown error", source: ShutdownError { msg: "shutdown grace period expired" } }
 Nov 12 16:27:45.988 INFO FTP exiting

```

title: Improve GCS system tests
body: Minor refactor and processed a few more cases.

title: Return STAT response as a multi-line in accordance with RFC 959
Actually makes the `Permissions` struct's field pub
body: ... you can't actually make a `Permissions` instance otherwise.

title: Replace futures with futures-util and use tokio's mpsc channels
body:
Drops dependency on `futures`, `futures-channel` (which was being imported by `futures`) and `tokio-stream`.

Also while testing it I used [feature resolver v2](https://blog.rust-lang.org/2021/03/25/Rust-1.51.0.html#cargos-new-feature-resolver) and noticed tokio should also have been imported with the `macros` feature, which is required in order for `tokio::select!` to work.

title: Include the number of links to a file
body:
In the future `links` could also be implemented for windows ([if I'm reading this right](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/os/windows/fs/trait.MetadataExt.html#tymethod.number_of_links)) and [wasi](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/os/wasi/fs/trait.MetadataExt.html#tymethod.nlink) once the respective APIs stabilize.

While at it also implements `gid` and `uid` for linux and unix targets.

Fixes #371
